column4: help , each time i try to load some modules for my wifi card and i get.. insmod: error inserting 'open8180.o': -1 Invalid module format
anyone?
anyone here know how to get wifi cards working???
be less vague
that's not a proper driver
drivers for the 2.6 kernel do not have the .o extension
where did you get that file from?
its made for Linux 2.6.X, so what should i do
i got it from realtek
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HowToSetUpNdiswrapper
does ndiswrapper support scanning?
don't know
so just to make sure, a 2.4.X driver wouldnt workin in 2.6 right, cause thats the other driver they have and im almost out of options
correct
if it ends in .o, it's not a 2.6 module
you'll get that error if it wasn't built for your exact kernel too, I think
just wanted to let you know thanks :)
i am now speaking to you from a wifi connection, hopefully my apps will work but atleast I got wifi
yay
you know of any wifi linux tools, like netstunbler is for windows
kismet
guess i'll hqave to fork out some $ to buy a card that will work with kismet and others without using ndiswrapper
my ipw2100 works fine with it, as do all prism-based cards
I gather ipw2200 works fine, too
